conclusion: Need to calculate the magnitude of the electric force experienced by the small ball at point B.
The ball is influenced by the electric forces due to the charges at points M and N.
The ball at point B experiences forces due to the charges at M (+Q) and N (-Q).
The force due to the charge at M is repulsive, and the force due to the charge at N is attractive.
M, N, and B form an equilateral triangle with side length L.
The distance from B to M and B to N is L.
The electric force due to the charge at M on the ball at B is F1 = k(qQ/L^2).
The electric force due to the charge at N on the ball at B is F2 = k(qQ/L^2).
F1 is directed away from M towards B.
F2 is directed towards N from B.
The angle between F1 and F2 is 60 degrees.
The resultant force F can be found using vector addition.
The resultant force is F = sqrt(F1^2 + F2^2 + 2F1F2 cos(60 degrees)).
The magnitude of the electric force experienced by the small ball when it reaches point B is F = sqrt(3) * k(qQ/L^2).
